verbs.description: crystallize (third-person singular simple present crystallizes, present participle crystallizing, simple past and past participle crystallized)

entries.meaning: (transitive, chemistry, physics) to make something form into crystals
examples: I crystallized the copper sulphate by slowly cooling a saturated solution.
The copper sulphate crystallized from solution.

entries.meaning: (transitive) to give something a definite or precise form
examples: After some thought, I crystallized my ideas for the paper.

entries.meaning: (transitive) to coat something with crystals, especially with sugar
examples: We crystallized the fruit by coating in sugar.
